UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Represents a user account within the PRIMELEGAL CONNECT application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

email.description: Email address of the user account.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

isLawyer.description: Indicates whether the user is a lawyer or not.

registrationDate.description: Date and time the user registered.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

specialty.description: The lawyer's primary area of legal practice.

bio.description: A professional biography for the lawyer.

linkedin.description: A link to the lawyer's LinkedIn profile.

PublicLawyerProfile.title: Public Lawyer Profile
PublicLawyerProfile.description: DEPRECATED: This entity is no longer in use. Public lawyer data is derived from the UserAccount entity with field-level security.

Case.title: Case
Case.description: Represents a legal case submitted by a user.

caseSubject.description: The subject line of the case.

documentType.description: The primary type of document associated with the case.

fileName.description: The name of the uploaded file.

notes.description: Detailed notes or description of the case.

submitted.description: The timestamp when the case was submitted.

status.description: The current status of the case.

definition.description: Stores user account information. The user can read/write their own document.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user. This is also the Firebase Authentication UID.

definition.description: DEPRECATED: This collection is no longer in use.

params.name: lawyerId
params.description: The unique identifier for the lawyer, which matches their Firebase Auth UID.

definition.description: Stores the cases submitted by a specific user. Access is controlled by user ownership. Users can read/write their own cases.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user who owns the case.

params.name: caseId
params.description: The unique identifier for the case.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support user-specific data. Each user has a document in the `/users` collection. Their legal cases are stored in a subcollection, `/users/{userId}/cases`, with security rules ensuring only the user can access their own cases. The `/lawyers` collection is deprecated.
